raw_text:
Cole refuses to blame van Persie
 
 Ashley Cole has refused to blame Robin van Persie for leaving Arsenal with no fully-fit strikers for the FA Cup fifth round replay at Sheffield United.
 
 Van Persie is suspended alongside Dennis Bergkamp and Jose Antonio Reyes after being sent off at Southampton when Arsenal had a numerical advantage. Thierry Henry is ruled out with an Achilles tendon injury but Cole said: "No-one is putting the blame on Robin. "It's just something that happens on the spur of the moment." Cole added: "I've done it before and I hope they didn't blame me for anything. "Of course he'll learn. I've been sent off a couple of times now and it's just one of those things when you go a bit crazy for one or two seconds. Freddie Ljungberg is likely to be used in an emergency striking role and will be partnered by either Arturo Lupoli, Quincy Owusu-Abeyie or Jeremie Aliadiere. Gunners boss Arsene Wenger said: "Freddie is an option but we need a second striker. "I have to decide whether it will be Aliadiere, Quincy or Lupoli who will start with him up front. Those three will be involved." Arsenal are also without winger Robert Pires, who sustained an ankle injury at St Mary's. Wenger added: "It doesn't look like anything is fractured, but it is a good ankle sprain. "It does not look like Pires will be ready for two to three weeks."
llama3.2:1b: Cole refuses to blame Van Persie for Arsenal's performance.
llama3.2:3b: Ashley Cole refuses to blame Robin van Persie for Arsenal's FA Cup fifth round replay absence due to suspensions and injuries, stating that such incidents can occur suddenly and implying he has also been sent off in the past.
gemma2:2b: Ashley Cole denies blaming Robin van Persie for the Arsenal striker shortage, attributing the situation as an "accidental" moment of frustration. Freddie Ljungberg may start as a substitute striker in the absence of Van Persie, Henry and other key players. Wenger is left with options for filling the second striker position between Aliadiere, Lupoli, and Owusu-Abeyie. Robert Pires has suffered an ankle sprain that could keep him out for two to three weeks.
qwen2.5:0.5b: Ashley Cole refuses to blame Robin van Persie for Arsenal's 5-on-5 FA Cup replay at Sheffield United. Cole said he hasn't made any contact with the striker and believes it's just a momentary incident, noting that Van Persie has been suspended alongside Bergkamp and Reyes. Cole says he won't regret continuing his career despite playing as a striker. He also mentioned that if Arsenal were to have an emergency striker available, they would likely opt for Aliadiere or Lupoli, with Quincy Owusu-Abeyie being the third option. The Gunners manager has two strikers left in reserve: Arturo Lupoli and Quincy Owusu-Abeyie.
qwen2.5:1.5b: Cole refuses to blame van Persie, Arsenal lacks fully-fit strikers for FA Cup fifth round replay despite Van Persie's suspension and injury troubles, likely starting Freddie Ljungberg or trio of Lupoli, Owusu-Abeyie, or Aliadiere. Pires injured ankle does not look serious but could be weeks away from returning.
qwen2.5:3b: Ashley Cole refuses to blame Robin van Persie for Arsenal’s FA Cup fifth round replay against Sheffield United due to van Persie's suspension. Cole suggests incidents occur “on the spur of the moment.” Thierry Henry is injured, and Cole expects Freddie Ljungberg to be a makeshift striker with potential partners like Arturo Lupoli, Quincy Owusu-Abayie or Jeremie Aliadiere. Arsenal manager Arsene Wenger indicates that Pires’ ankle injury might prevent him from playing for two to three weeks.

Ashley Cole has refused to blame Robin van Persie for leaving Arsenal with no fully-fit strikers for the FA Cup fifth round replay at Sheffield United.

Van Persie is suspended alongside Dennis Bergkamp and Jose Antonio Reyes after being sent off at Southampton when Arsenal had a numerical advantage. Thierry Henry is ruled out with an Achilles tendon injury but Cole said: "No-one is putting the blame on Robin. "It's just something that happens on the spur of the moment." Cole added: "I've done it before and I hope they didn't blame me for anything. "Of course he'll learn. I've been sent off a couple of times now and it's just one of those things when you go a bit crazy for one or two seconds. Freddie Ljungberg is likely to be used in an emergency striking role and will be partnered by either Arturo Lupoli, Quincy Owusu-Abeyie or Jeremie Aliadiere. Gunners boss Arsene Wenger said: "Freddie is an option but we need a second striker. "I have to decide whether it will be Aliadiere, Quincy or Lupoli who will start with him up front. Those three will be involved." Arsenal are also without winger Robert Pires, who sustained an ankle injury at St Mary's. Wenger added: "It doesn't look like anything is fractured, but it is a good ankle sprain. "It does not look like Pires will be ready for two to three weeks." 

The key points in this summary are that Cole has refused to blame Van Persie, that van Persie was suspended by various individuals, and that Van Persie suffered an Achilles tendon injury.
smollm:1.7b: Cole refuses to blame van Persie for leaving Arsenal with no fully-fit strikers for the FA Cup fifth round replay at Sheffield United.

Cole refuses to blame Robin van Persie for Arsenal's loss in their FA Cup fifth round replay against Sheffield United. Van Persie was suspended after being sent off at Southampton with Arsenal having a numerical advantage there. Cole mentioned that the incident is something that just happens on the spur of the moment, not specifically named as someone else's fault. Freddie Ljungberg is considered for an emergency role, possibly starting with either Arturo lupoli, Quincy owusu-abeeyie, or jeremie aliadiere. Arsenal is missing Robert pires due to an ankle injury at St Mary's and it's uncertain if he'll be ready in time. Wenger is looking for another striker, considering Aliadiere, Quincy, or Lupoli.
tinyllama:1.1b: Despite Arsenal's loss in the Premier League, defender Cole has declined to lay any blame on Robin van Persie for his absence from their FA Cup fifth round replacement team. Van Persie was sent off against Southampton during a numerical advantage, but Cole said that he didn't put the blame on van Persie himself. Cole also noted that the club has had other strikers who have not been fully fit, including Dennis Bergkamp and Jose Antonio Reyes, and they will be relying on Freddie Ljubljancic as a possible option in their emergency striking role. Arsenal coach Arsène Wenger has said that Freddie is an option but will need to decide between Aliadiere, Quincy Owusu-Abeyie or Jeremié Aliadiere for a second striker up front. The club also needs a second striker injured wingman Robert Pirés to miss a couple of weeks, with Arsenal's other two options, Robert Pirés and ankle injuries, not available.
tinydolphin:1.1b: Arsenal manager Arsene Wenger has decided that Dutch striker Robin van Persie should take the blame for leaving Arsenal without a fully-fit squad for their FA Cup fifth round replay match against Sheffield United. Van Persie, who is suspended alongside Dennis Bergkamp and Jose Antonio Reyes due to being sent off at Southampton earlier this season, will be replaced by an injured Freddie Ljungberg. The Gunners have also been without winger Robert Pires, who suffered a sprained ankle at St. Mary's on Monday. Wenger is expected to make the decision regarding which player will start up front in the match against Sheffield United on January 15th.

Van Persie was suspended alongside Dennis Bergkamp and Jose Antonio Reyes after being sent off at Southampton when Arsenal had a numerical advantage. Thierry Henry is ruled out with an Achilles tendon injury but Cole said: "No-one is putting the blame on Robin." Cole added: "I've done it before and I hope they didn't blame me for anything. It' s just something that happens on the spur of the moment." Cole also stated that Freddie Ljungberg may be used in an emergency striking role and will partner with either Arturo Lupoli, Quincy Owusu-Abeyie or Jeremie Aliadiere. However, Arsenal are also without winger Robert Pires due to a sprained ankle. Wenger has not commented on whether he will continue to play him in the remaining games of the season.
